intro: Stenocarpus davallioides, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
